posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.94 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Help keep important information easily accessible with pinned messages. Your most frequently asked questions, dinner reservations, and vacation itineraries are already top of mind. Now they can be top of chat as well.

Backups is now available in production as well as TestFlight, but your early feedback is still crucial for us as we roll this out to a broader audience.

Please continue to report any issues you encounter!

When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you’re experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.93 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.94.0.1325-beta

79 new commits since 7.93.0.1320-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.94 [1]

  • Member label receive & send FFs [2]

  • Swiftify dataMessageBuilderWithThread [3]

  • Swiftify OWSOutgoingNullMessage [4]

  • Fix a typo in a comment. [5]

  • Swiftify OWSStaticOutgoingMessage [16]

  • Add optional video file for codec testing [17]

  • Swiftify OWSEndSessionMessage [18]

  • Add new attachment limits in internal builds [19]

  • Make attachment limits hot-swappable [21]

  • Swiftify OWSOutgoingReactionMessage [22]

  • Skip the MSL for just-SKDM messages [23]

  • Move ImageQualityLevel.defaultCallingCode(…) [24]

  • Remove never-needed codegen files [25]

  • Remove usleep call from unit tests [34]

  • Remove unused runLoop parameter [35]

  • Remove unused stream transform logic [36]

  • Fix layout for pinned messages view [37]

  • Move push registration isSimulator check [39]

  • Don't assume Attachment can be fetched for an AttachmentReference [40]

  • Remove unused MessageSendEncryptionError [41]

  • Prefer OWSGenericError in a few places [42]

  • Permissions check for setting member labels [43]

  • always show star beside winning poll option [44]

  • Remove TSGroupMetaMessage [45]

  • Add superclass for transient outgoing messages [46]

  • Add SendableMessage protocol [47]

  • Remove shouldBeSaved from SDSCodableModel [48]

  • Don’t retry errors by default [49]

  • String and design changes re: "nonprofit awareness" [50]

  • Simplify sendVerificationStateSyncMessage [51]

  • Handle empty linked device names [52]

  • Remove unused table item. [53]

  • Document/clean up SendableMessage [54]

  • Remove redundant attachment upload check [55]

  • Fix typo in comment [56]

  • Prefer constants for durations [57]

  • Updated design for "Get Started" cards. [58]

  • Fix invalid bottom inset in chat list in landscape when "Get Started" cards are visible. [59]

  • Add comment about transient message send statuses [60]

  • Update SVR2 enclaves [61]

  • Fix log line in BackupDownloadQueueRunner [62]

  • Remove unnecessary upload size check [63]

  • Replace MessageType.none case with optional [64]

  • Fix pinned message send rules [65]

  • Remove AppVersion from account attributes updater [66]

  • Validate proto inputs from pinned messages [67]

  • Check vote count before inserting [68]

  • Add call diagnostics preview [69]

  • Fix view transition when setting a chat wallpaper [70]

  • Use BackupAttachmentDownloadTracker for the chat list download progress [71]

  • Require TSContactThread for some messages [72]

  • Fix various bottom bar priorities [73]

  • Uncodegen OWSDisappearingMessagesConfiguration [74]

  • Run swiftformat . using v0.59.0 [75]

  • Stricter rules for when we exclude an attachment from Backups [76]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.63.0 [77]

  • Update release notes [78]

  • Update translations [79]

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

Tapping on the pinned message bar to cycle through the messages jumps to the alternate message.

Pinned message bar shows message A but jumps to message B.

Expected: jumps to message A.

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked: This is the intended behavior. It jumps to the one that’s currently shown in the pinned message bar, and then the pinned message bar updates to show the next pinned message.

I’m technically on the production version of Signal iOS, but since the backup feature still is in beta and “your early feedback is still crucial for us”, I’m leaving this feedback here:

It seems that backup is only performed at night (approx. 3 AM) if the phone is plugged in (charging). If one doesn’t charge their phone at night, this is a bit sub-optimal. Sometimes, I’ve noticed that the phone performs backup upon being connected to power in the morning, but that certainly doesn’t happen every time. This easily leads to 48+ hours of no backups. (I haven’t tried repeating this behavior for much longer periods, so for all I know eventually backups are forced regardless of nightly scheduling.)

Unless this is due to some iOS limitation with the current background job implementation, I would really like and prefer that backup ran during the night regardless of charging state – unless the battery level was critically low or something. I did not use low power mode during this testing and had a battery level of 70%+ throughout the night. I’ve started charging at night to work around this (with the potential fire hazard that includes).

Debug logs after connecting the phone to power in the morning where no backup was performed at night: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.93.0/cd95673f547c78c49a37ef906f0142e64b7c587997af94ea913fe8dbba35be6f.zip

No backup was performed in the morning after connecting to power either (I waited a bit before collecting the logs), so at the time of writing this message it is 6:45 PM and no backup has been performed since yesterday 3 AM (~40 hours).

If this behavior is unexpected, let me know if you want me to try/test anything out, collect more logs or contact support if that is the more appropriate way to go. If this behavior is expected:

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked:
If we remove the “plugged in” restriction, iOS imposes a strict limit on CPU consumption, and that means that we’re not able to complete medium/large backups automatically.

If you don’t charge your phone at night, we should be making a backup at the next available opportunity, though it is ultimately up to iOS when that gets scheduled. It should be the next time you plug your phone in, but I believe the phone also needs to be “idle” (according to iOS’ definition of “idle”). We’ll take a look at why it wasn’t making a backup in the morning because it should be.

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked: I’ve found an issue with the scheduling logic that may cause longer delays between backups than we intended. This change likely won’t be in production until next week (in v7.95), but please do install it when it’s available and let us know if you’re still seeing longer than expected delays between backups.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.95 release.
